lead_paragraph: Marc Crawford was fired as coach of the Los Angeles Kings on Tuesday after his team finished with the fewest points in the Western Conference. He spent two seasons with the team and had a year left on his contract. Dean Lombardi, the team’s president and general manager, said that he and the Kings’ owners had decided to rebuild rather than try to create an immediate Stanley Cup contender, and Crawford was not the coach for such a team. Crawford coached the Kings to a 59-84-21 record in his two seasons. Last season, the Kings had 71 points, tied with Tampa Bay for the fewest in the league.
